content.body: Right, I think that's what'd happen, with `let {a as b: {c}} = expr;` for further destucturing *alongside* the naming. (In this case, storing expr.a as b, and expr.a.c as c.)

content.body: Well that's just destructing not pattern matching
As a pattern it would be `{a: as b and {c}}`
Those two syntaxes are very much at odds with each other.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Those two syntaxes are very much at odds with each other.

content.body: You have on as `{ a as b: c }` and the other as `{ a: as b and c }`. Shifting the placement of the `:` is very confusing.
content.formatted_body: You have on as { a as b: c } and the other as { a: as b and c }. Shifting the placement of the : is very confusing.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: You have on as `{ a as b: c }` and the other as `{ a: as b and c }`. Shifting the placement of the `:` is very confusing.

content.body: And if you're going to use `as b`, I'd rather find something clearer in the way that `let b` is clearer. `as` is an infix keyword, not a prefix keyword, so its usage here is not clear.
